title: Gabrielle Union and her daughter win Halloween in Bring It On costumes
text:
The Clovers are back (Picture: Gabrielle Union/ Instagram)

Gabrielle Union has given us everything we wanted by dressing up her and her daughter in Bring It On costumes.

The actress shared a series of photos of her and daughter Kaavia James, 11 months, wearing Halloween outfits inspired by the classic 2000 cheerleading movie.

The two posed for the camera in their Clovers uniforms and Kaavia might even be wearing the outfit better than anyone in the movie ever did.

Gabrielle, 46 captioned the images: ‘Brought It. #CaliforniaLove.’

The green uniform complete with gold bows and white sneakers took us in a time machine back to the simple old days where watching cheerleaders fight was the norm.

Gabrielle also shared a cute video combining her famous scenes from the movie with footage of her and Kaavia recreating the cheer… Kind of.

She began to recreate the cheer before her daughter abruptly interrupted and begged to be picked up.

Be aggressive! (Picture: Gabrielle Union/Instagram)

Meanwhile, Gabrielle hasn’t aged a day (Picture: Moviestore/REX)

Like a true cheerleader.

‘Ice Ice Ice… Its COLD asf,’ the star captioned the post.

Last year Gabrielle welcomed a daughter via surrogacy, however, the star admitted her feelings of ‘failure’ and inadequacy at not carrying the baby herself.

Her and her husband Dwyane Wade welcomed little Kaavia James after turning to a surrogate.

Bring It On fans have also been treated to a mini-reunion last month, as Kirsten Dunst and Gabrielle came together to model the latest looks from Rodarte.

They’re perky and cute AND popular to boot.

Kirsten has long been a champion of Rodarte so it wasn’t all that surprising to see her modelling the fashion house’s Spring 2020 look, however, the appearance of Gabrielle had us well and truly shooketh.

We said brrr it’s cold in here – there must be a reunion in the atmosphere.

Cheerleading Queen (Picture: Daria Kobayashi Ritch / Rodarte)

In the collection of surreal images, both actresses don dreamy wares alongside a swag of famous faces including Lili Reinhart, the Haim sisters and Roma actress Yalitza Aparicio.

But it was this Bring It On moment that had us all in a tizz, as Kirsten took to Twitter on 5 September to share shots of her alongside Gabrielle.

‘It’s been brought,’ she wrote, alongside tags of the designer and the actress, quoting a famous line from the movie.
